title: Weird/Unproven Personal Theories
content:
I find that when I am absorbed laying out type   
or making glyphs in FL I come up with rough   
theories/ideas/saying pertaining to typography.   
None of which are proven, just a sudden thought.   
I was wondering if anyone has little snippets   
of ideas they would share. They don't have to   
be right, just more or less your own!   
   
I'll start. "The perfect glyph only ever exists   
within its own family (context), never outside"
author: kris

comments.content:
The idea "singularities" that are most memorable to me seem to be the ones most paradoxical. For example that "a text font has to have a certain ugliness about it", or that "you can never _show_ a concept, you can only _explain_ it".   
   
hhp

"One is the loneliest number"   
   
It's those massive sidebearings.   
   
And to keep it appropriately segregated, you shouldn't fit/kern it too tightly.   
   
This is a principle that can be extended...

The eyes rule. Rules lie. Eye the lies to change the rules,
